content:
DocumentPaginator Class

In this Article

Provides an abstract base class that supports creation of multiple-page elements from a single document.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class DocumentPaginator

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • DocumentPaginator

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

If you need automatic background repagination in response to events such as changing the page size of a FlowDocument, then use DynamicDocumentPaginator as your base class.

Constructors summary

DocumentPaginator()

Initializes a new instance of the DocumentPaginator class.

Properties summary

IsPageCountValid

When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageCount* is the total number of pages.
PageCount

When overridden in a derived class, gets a count of the number of pages currently formatted
PageSize

When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the suggested width and height of each page.
Source

When overridden in a derived class, returns the element being paginated.

Methods summary

CancelAsync(Object)

Cancels a previous stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.GetPageAsync* or stem.Windows.Documents.DynamicDocumentPaginator.GetPageNumberAsync* operation.
ComputePageCount()

Forces a pagination of the content, updates stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageCount* with the new total, and sets stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* to true.
ComputePageCountAsync()

Asynchronously, forces a pagination of the content, updates stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageCount* with the new total, and sets stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* to true.
ComputePageCountAsync(Object)

Asynchronously, forces a pagination of the content, updates stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageCount* with the new total, sets stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* to true.
GetPage(Int32)

When overridden in a derived class, gets the DocumentPage for the specified page number.
GetPageAsync(Int32)

Asynchronously returns (through the GetPageCompleted event) the DocumentPage for the specified page number.
GetPageAsync(Int32,Object)

Asynchronously returns (through the GetPageCompleted event) the DocumentPage for the specified page number and assigns the specified ID to the asynchronous task.
OnComputePageCountCompleted(AsyncCompletedEventArgs)

Raises the ComputePageCountCompleted event.
OnGetPageCompleted(GetPageCompletedEventArgs)

Raises the GetPageCompleted event.
OnPagesChanged(PagesChangedEventArgs)

Raises the PagesChanged event.

Events summary

ComputePageCountCompleted

Occurs when a stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.ComputePageCountAsync* operation has finished.
GetPageCompleted

Occurs when stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.GetPageAsync* has completed.
PagesChanged

Occurs when the document content is changed.

Constructors

  • DocumentPaginator()

    Initializes a new instance of the DocumentPaginator class.

    protected DocumentPaginator ();

Properties

  • IsPageCountValid

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageCount* is the total number of pages.

    public abstract bool IsPageCountValid { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if pagination is complete and stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageCount* is the total number of pages; otherwise, false, if pagination is in process and stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageCount* is the number of pages currently formatted (not the total).

      This value may revert to false, after being true, if stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageSize* or content changes; because those events would force a repagination.

  • PageCount

    When overridden in a derived class, gets a count of the number of pages currently formatted

    public abstract int PageCount { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      A count of the number of pages that have been formatted.

    Remarks

    If IsPageCountValid is true, pagination is complete and PageCount is the total number of pages in the document.

    If IsPageCountValid is false, pagination is in process and PageCount is the number of pages currently formatted (not the total).

    This value may change if PageSize or content changes, because those events would force a repagination.

  • PageSize

    When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the suggested width and height of each page.

    public abstract System.Windows.Size PageSize { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Size

      A Size representing the width and height of each page.

    Remarks

    The DocumentPaginator may override the value of this property. Users should check Size.

    Example

    The following example shows how to set the PageSize. 

    ' ------------------------ CreateFixedDocument -----------------------
''' <summary>
'''   Creates an empty FixedDocument.</summary>
''' <returns>
'''   An empty FixedDocument without any content.</returns>
Private Function CreateFixedDocument() As FixedDocument
	Dim fixedDocument As New FixedDocument()
	fixedDocument.DocumentPaginator.PageSize = New Size(96 * 8.5, 96 * 11)
	Return fixedDocument
End Function

    // ------------------------ CreateFixedDocument -----------------------
/// <summary>
///   Creates an empty FixedDocument.</summary>
/// <returns>
///   An empty FixedDocument without any content.</returns>
private FixedDocument CreateFixedDocument()
{
    FixedDocument fixedDocument = new FixedDocument();
    fixedDocument.DocumentPaginator.PageSize = new Size(96 * 8.5, 96 * 11);
    return fixedDocument;
}
  • Source

    When overridden in a derived class, returns the element being paginated.

    public abstract System.Windows.Documents.IDocumentPaginatorSource Source { get; }

    Property Value

    • IDocumentPaginatorSource

      An IDocumentPaginatorSource representing the element being paginated.

    Remarks

    The object returned has this DocumentPaginator as the value of its DocumentPaginator property. It is guaranteed to have such a property because it implements IDocumentPaginatorSource.

Methods

  • CancelAsync(Object)

    Cancels a previous stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.GetPageAsync* or stem.Windows.Documents.DynamicDocumentPaginator.GetPageNumberAsync* operation.

    public virtual void CancelAsync (object userState);

    Parameters

    • userState
      System.Object

      The original userState passed to stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.GetPageAsync*, stem.Windows.Documents.DynamicDocumentPaginator.GetPageNumberAsync*, or stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.ComputePageCountAsync* that identifies the asynchronous task to cancel.

    Remarks

    If userState is null, then all asynchronous tasks are cancelled.

  • ComputePageCount()

    Forces a pagination of the content, updates stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageCount* with the new total, and sets stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* to true.

    public virtual void ComputePageCount ();

    Remarks

    IsPageCountValid will be true immediately after this is called. If content is modified or PageSize is changed after this method is called, IsPageCountValid will likely revert to false.

  • ComputePageCountAsync()

    Asynchronously, forces a pagination of the content, updates stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageCount* with the new total, and sets stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* to true.

    public virtual void ComputePageCountAsync ();

    Remarks

    The only way to cancel the asynchronous operation of this method is to cancel all asynchronous operations. Contrast this with the other overload of this method: ComputePageCountAsync(Object).

  • ComputePageCountAsync(Object)

    Asynchronously, forces a pagination of the content, updates stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.PageCount* with the new total, sets stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.IsPageCountValid* to true.

    public virtual void ComputePageCountAsync (object userState);

    Parameters

    • userState
      System.Object

      A unique identifier for the asynchronous task.

    Remarks

    The specified ID is assigned to the asynchronous task.

    This overload of the method makes it possible to cancel this asynchronous operation without cancelling all asynchronous operations.

  • GetPage(Int32)

    When overridden in a derived class, gets the DocumentPage for the specified page number.

    public abstract System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage GetPage (int pageNumber);

    Parameters

    • pageNumber
      Int32

      The zero-based page number of the document page that is needed.

    Returns

    • DocumentPage

      The DocumentPage for the specified pageNumber, or DocumentPage if the page does not exist.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      pageNumber is negative.

    Remarks

    If pages prior to pageNumber have not been formatted, they will be paginated synchronously prior to returning the requested page.

    GetPageAsync provides similar functionality as GetPage, but for asynchronous operation.

  • GetPageAsync(Int32)

    Asynchronously returns (through the GetPageCompleted event) the DocumentPage for the specified page number.

    public virtual void GetPageAsync (int pageNumber);

    Parameters

    • pageNumber
      Int32

      The zero-based page number of the document page that is needed.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      pageNumber is negative.

    Remarks

    The only way to cancel the asynchronous operation of this method is to cancel all asynchronous operations. Contrast this with the other overload of this method: GetPageAsync(Int32,Object).

    This method raises the GetPageCompleted event. The DocumentPage is passed to the event as one of the event arguments. See GetPageAsync(Int32,Object) for how to use this method to get the page.

  • GetPageAsync(Int32,Object)

    Asynchronously returns (through the GetPageCompleted event) the DocumentPage for the specified page number and assigns the specified ID to the asynchronous task.

    public virtual void GetPageAsync (int pageNumber, object userState);

    Parameters

    • pageNumber
      Int32

      The zero-based page number of the DocumentPage to get.

    • userState
      System.Object

      A unique identifier for the asynchronous task.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      pageNumber is negative.

    Remarks

    This overload of the method makes it possible to cancel this asynchronous operation without cancelling all asynchronous operations.

    This method raises the GetPageCompleted event. The DocumentPage is passed to the event as one of the event arguments.

    The following steps illustrate how to retrieve a DocumentPage asynchronously:

    1. Create a GetPageCompletedEventHandler delegate and add it to be notified of GetPageCompleted events.

    2. Call GetPageAsync specifying the pageNumber desired and a unique userState, which will be used to identify the completion of the asynchronous event.

    3. When the event occurs and the delegate is called, compare the event's GetPageCompletedEventArgs.UserState property with the original GetPageAsync userState parameter. (The GetPageCompletedEventArgs.PageNumber property will also match the pageNumber specified in the GetPageAsync call.)

    4. When the GetPageCompletedEventArgs.UserState property matches the original GetPageAsync userState, the operation is complete and the page is ready.

    5. Call GetPage to retrieve the formatted DocumentPage.

  • OnComputePageCountCompleted(AsyncCompletedEventArgs)

    Raises the ComputePageCountCompleted event.

    protected virtual void OnComputePageCountCompleted (System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      AsyncCompletedEventArgs

      An AsyncCompletedEventArgs that contains the event data.

  • OnGetPageCompleted(GetPageCompletedEventArgs)

    Raises the GetPageCompleted event.

    protected virtual void OnGetPageCompleted (System.Windows.Documents.GetPageCompletedEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      GetPageCompletedEventArgs

      A GetPageCompletedEventArgs that contains the event data.

  • OnPagesChanged(PagesChangedEventArgs)

    Raises the PagesChanged event.

    protected virtual void OnPagesChanged (System.Windows.Documents.PagesChangedEventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      PagesChangedEventArgs

      A PagesChangedEventArgs that contains the event data.

Events

  • ComputePageCountCompleted

    Occurs when a stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.ComputePageCountAsync* operation has finished.

    public event System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventHandler ComputePageCountCompleted;
  • GetPageCompleted

    Occurs when stem.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator.GetPageAsync* has completed.

    public event System.Windows.Documents.GetPageCompletedEventHandler GetPageCompleted;
  • PagesChanged

    Occurs when the document content is changed.

    public event System.Windows.Documents.PagesChangedEventHandler PagesChanged;
